speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Thank you for calling ISS Insurance Ltd. My name is Sarah. How may I assist you today?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Yes, I need to arrange travel insurance. I've been a loyal customer for years, you know, so I expect the best policy.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Thank you for your loyalty, sir. I can certainly help you with gathering the details for a travel insurance quote. To start, could you please let me know where you'll be travelling to?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: We're planning a trip to Australia. And it needs to cover everything properly, none of this fine print nonsense.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Noted, Australia. And how long will you be away for?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: We'll be away for 10 days. Just the two of us traveling. We're based in Singapore, obviously.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Alright, a 10-day trip to Australia for two travelers departing from Singapore. And may I ask the age group of the travelers?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: We're mostly around 56-65 years old. Look, let's get to the important stuff. It's primarily a golf trip.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Okay, a golf trip. Are there any specific activities planned besides golf that we should be aware of?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Golf is the main event. And I need absolute assurance my golf equipment is covered against loss or damage – my clubs are expensive. Also, if something happens and I can't play, say I get injured, I expect reimbursement for any unused green fees I've pre-paid. Is that clear?

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Okay, I'm noting down coverage for golf equipment and reimbursement for unused green fees due to unforeseen circumstances.

speaker: Customer
dialogue: And what about the golf buggy? If I accidentally damage it on the course, ISS needs to cover that. It's just common sense.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Alright, I've added potential coverage for accidental damage to a rented golf buggy to your requirements list.

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Good. One more thing for golf – I'm feeling lucky. If I score a hole-in-one, there should be some kind of payout or special benefit. Top players get that, and as a long-standing customer, I expect something similar.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Okay, I have noted your request for a potential benefit related to achieving a hole-in-one during your trip. Are there any other requirements regarding your trip? Perhaps concerning travel disruptions or medical needs?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Of course! Look, airlines lose luggage all the time. I need full coverage if my bags are lost or damaged. And don't tell me there's a delay limit; if my bag is delayed even a few hours, I expect compensation for necessities.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Understood. So, coverage for lost, damaged, or delayed baggage is a requirement.

speaker: Customer
dialogue: And travel delays! Flights get delayed, connections are missed. I won't be out of pocket for hotels or meals because of the airline's incompetence. That needs to be covered.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Right, I've noted cover for additional expenses due to significant travel delays.

speaker: Customer
dialogue: And trip cancellation. If something happens – say, I fall sick before going, or some emergency comes up – I expect a full refund for my travel costs. No arguments.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Okay, requirement noted for trip cancellation coverage due to specified unforeseen events like illness. What about medical cover during the trip itself?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Absolutely essential. If we need a doctor or end up in hospital over there, ISS better cover it fully. No messing about with claims.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Understood, comprehensive medical coverage during the trip is required. Just related to that, are there any health considerations we should be aware of for the travellers? For example, any pre-existing medical conditions?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Well, my wife has high blood pressure, but it's managed. Do we need to declare high blood pressure? It shouldn't be an issue, it's perfectly stable. Just make sure it's covered like anything else. I don't want any excuses later if something happens.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Okay, I've noted that one traveler has managed high blood pressure and you require this to be considered within the coverage. Are there any specific medical equipment needs, like a wheelchair or CPAP machine?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: No, nothing like that. Just make sure the policy reflects everything I've told you. Our budget for insurance is flexible, but I expect premium service and coverage for what I pay.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Okay, thank you. Let me quickly summarize the requirements I've noted down. You're looking for travel insurance for two adults, aged 56-65, traveling from Singapore to Australia for 10 days. The key requirements are: Comprehensive medical coverage, including consideration for pre-existing high blood pressure; trip cancellation protection; cover for significant travel delays; cover for lost, damaged, or delayed baggage. Specifically for your golf activities, you require cover for your golf equipment, potential reimbursement for unused green fees, cover for accidental damage to a rented golf buggy, and you've requested information on any available benefit for scoring a hole-in-one. Is that all correct?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Yes, that sounds about right. But make sure those golf requirements are properly included, especially the hole-in-one bit and the buggy damage. I don't want any standard package that overlooks my specific needs just because I'm a loyal customer. This needs to be handled properly.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: I have documented all these specific requirements clearly, sir. Thank you for providing these details. This information will be used to identify the appropriate options based on your needs.

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Fine. Just get it done right.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Thank you again for calling ISS Insurance Ltd. Have a good day.

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Right. Goodbye.
